controller

Class Agenda

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Agenda

  • public class Agenda
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents an agenda like data structure. The agenda is made up of a list of pending goals (those goals that haven't been explored yet), a list of preempted goals (those goals that have been suspended due to a discrepancy) and a list of reached goals (those goals that have been completed). Also, it stores the current goal, which is the one that the agent is trying to achieve at the moment.

    The lists of pending goals and preempted goals are sorted by priority. See PDDLSingleGoal to get more information.

    Author:
    Vladislav Nikolov Vasilev

      • getCurrentGoal

        public PDDLSingleGoal getCurrentGoal()

      • setCurrentGoal

        public boolean setCurrentGoal()
        Method that sets the current goal. It chooses between the first goal of the pending goals list and the first one of the preempted goals list. The goal's priority is considered when choosing between them.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the goal has been set successfully or false otherwise.

      • haltCurrentGoal

        public void haltCurrentGoal()
        Method that allows to halt the current goal in case some discrepancy is found.

      • updateReachedGoals

        public void updateReachedGoals()
        Method that allows to update the reached goals list. It should be called when the current goal has been reached successfully.

      • containedPredicateInPendingGoals

        public PDDLSingleGoal containedPredicateInPendingGoals(java.lang.String predicate)
        Method that allows to check whether a predicate is contained in the pending goals list.
        Parameters:
        predicate - Predicate to be searched.
        Returns:
        Returns a PDDLSingleGoal instance containing the predicate if it is found and null otherwise.
